segment.source: Block untrusted fonts in an enterprise (Windows 10)
segment.target: Block untrusted fonts in an enterprise (Windows 10)

segment.source: To help protect your company from attacks which may originate from untrusted or attacker controlled font files, we’ve created the Blocking Untrusted Fonts feature.
segment.target: To help protect your company from attacks which may originate from untrusted or attacker controlled font files, we’ve created the Blocking Untrusted Fonts feature.

segment.source: Block untrusted fonts in an enterprise
segment.target: Block untrusted fonts in an enterprise

segment.source: To help protect your company from attacks which may originate from untrusted or attacker controlled font files, we’ve created the Blocking Untrusted Fonts feature.
segment.target: To help protect your company from attacks which may originate from untrusted or attacker controlled font files, we’ve created the Blocking Untrusted Fonts feature.

segment.source: Using this feature, you can turn on a global setting that stops your employees from loading untrusted fonts processed using the Graphics Device Interface (GDI) onto your network.
segment.target: Using this feature, you can turn on a global setting that stops your employees from loading untrusted fonts processed using the Graphics Device Interface (GDI) onto your network.

segment.source: Untrusted fonts are any font installed outside of the directory.
segment.target: Untrusted fonts are any font installed outside of the directory.

segment.source: Blocking untrusted fonts helps prevent both remote (web-based or email-based) and local EOP attacks that can happen during the font file-parsing process.
segment.target: Blocking untrusted fonts helps prevent both remote (web-based or email-based) and local EOP attacks that can happen during the font file-parsing process.

segment.source: What does this mean for me?
segment.target: What does this mean for me?

segment.source: Blocking untrusted fonts helps improve your network and employee protection against font-processing-related attacks.
segment.target: Blocking untrusted fonts helps improve your network and employee protection against font-processing-related attacks.

segment.source: By default, this feature is not turned on.
segment.target: By default, this feature is not turned on.

segment.source: How does this feature work?
segment.target: How does this feature work?

segment.source: There are 3 ways to use this feature:
segment.target: There are 3 ways to use this feature:

segment.source: On.
segment.target: On.

segment.source: Helps stop any font processed using GDI from loading outside of the directory.
segment.target: Helps stop any font processed using GDI from loading outside of the directory.

segment.source: It also turns on event logging.
segment.target: It also turns on event logging.

segment.source: Audit.
segment.target: Audit.

segment.source: Turns on event logging, but doesn’t block fonts from loading, regardless of location.
segment.target: Turns on event logging, but doesn’t block fonts from loading, regardless of location.

segment.source: The name of the apps that use untrusted fonts appear in your event log.
segment.target: The name of the apps that use untrusted fonts appear in your event log.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you aren’t quite ready to deploy this feature into your organization, you can run it in Audit mode to see if not loading untrusted fonts causes any usability or compatibility issues.
segment.target: If you aren’t quite ready to deploy this feature into your organization, you can run it in Audit mode to see if not loading untrusted fonts causes any usability or compatibility issues.

segment.source: Exclude apps to load untrusted fonts.
segment.target: Exclude apps to load untrusted fonts.

segment.source: You can exclude specific apps, allowing them to load untrusted fonts, even while this feature is turned on.
segment.target: You can exclude specific apps, allowing them to load untrusted fonts, even while this feature is turned on.

segment.source: For instructions, see Fix apps having problems because of blocked fonts.
segment.target: For instructions, see Fix apps having problems because of blocked fonts.

segment.source: Potential reductions in functionality
segment.target: Potential reductions in functionality

segment.source: After you turn this feature on, your employees might experience reduced functionality when:
segment.target: After you turn this feature on, your employees might experience reduced functionality when:

segment.source: Sending a print job to a remote printer server that uses this feature and where the spooler process hasn’t been specifically excluded.
segment.target: Sending a print job to a remote printer server that uses this feature and where the spooler process hasn’t been specifically excluded.

segment.source: In this situation, any fonts that aren’t already available in the server’s %windir%/Fonts folder won’t be used.
segment.target: In this situation, any fonts that aren’t already available in the server’s %windir%/Fonts folder won’t be used.

segment.source: Printing using fonts provided by the installed printer’s graphics .dll file, outside of the %windir%/Fonts folder.
segment.target: Printing using fonts provided by the installed printer’s graphics .dll file, outside of the %windir%/Fonts folder.

segment.source: For more information, see Introduction to Printer Graphics DLLs.
segment.target: For more information, see Introduction to Printer Graphics DLLs.

segment.source: Using first or third-party apps that use memory-based fonts.
segment.target: Using first or third-party apps that use memory-based fonts.

segment.source: Using Internet Explorer to look at websites that use embedded fonts.
segment.target: Using Internet Explorer to look at websites that use embedded fonts.

segment.source: In this situation, the feature blocks the embedded font, causing the website to use a default font.
segment.target: In this situation, the feature blocks the embedded font, causing the website to use a default font.

segment.source: However, not all fonts have all of the characters, so the website might render differently.
segment.target: However, not all fonts have all of the characters, so the website might render differently.

segment.source: Using desktop Office to look at documents with embedded fonts.
segment.target: Using desktop Office to look at documents with embedded fonts.

segment.source: In this situation, content shows up using a default font picked by Office.
segment.target: In this situation, content shows up using a default font picked by Office.

segment.source: Turn on and use the Blocking Untrusted Fonts feature
segment.target: Turn on and use the Blocking Untrusted Fonts feature

segment.source: To turn this feature on, off, or to use audit mode:
segment.target: To turn this feature on, off, or to use audit mode:

segment.source: Open the registry editor (regedit.exe) and go to .
segment.target: Open the registry editor (regedit.exe) and go to .

segment.source: If the MitigationOptions key isn't there, right-click and add a new QWORD (64-bit) Value, renaming it to MitigationOptions.
segment.target: If the MitigationOptions key isn't there, right-click and add a new QWORD (64-bit) Value, renaming it to MitigationOptions.

segment.source: Update the Value data of the MitigationOptions key, making sure you keep your existing value, like in the important note below:
segment.target: Update the Value data of the MitigationOptions key, making sure you keep your existing value, like in the important note below:

segment.source: To turn this feature on.
segment.target: To turn this feature on.

segment.source: To turn this feature off.
segment.target: To turn this feature off.

segment.source: To audit with this feature.
segment.target: To audit with this feature.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Your existing MitigationOptions values should be saved during your update.
segment.target: Your existing MitigationOptions values should be saved during your update.

segment.source: For example, if the current value is 1000, your updated value should be 1000000001000.
segment.target: For example, if the current value is 1000, your updated value should be 1000000001000.

segment.source: Restart your computer.
segment.target: Restart your computer.

segment.source: View the event log
segment.target: View the event log

segment.source: After you turn this feature on, or start using Audit mode, you can look at your event logs for details.
segment.target: After you turn this feature on, or start using Audit mode, you can look at your event logs for details.

segment.source: To look at your event log
segment.target: To look at your event log

segment.source: Open the event viewer (eventvwr.exe) and go to Application and Service Logs/Microsoft/Windows/Win32k/Operational.
segment.target: Open the event viewer (eventvwr.exe) and go to Application and Service Logs/Microsoft/Windows/Win32k/Operational.

segment.source: Scroll down to EventID: 260 and review the relevant events.
segment.target: Scroll down to EventID: 260 and review the relevant events.

segment.source: Event Example 1 - MS Word
segment.target: Event Example 1 - MS Word

segment.source: WINWORD.EXE attempted loading a font that is restricted by font loading policy.
segment.target: WINWORD.EXE attempted loading a font that is restricted by font loading policy.

segment.source: FontType: Memory
segment.target: FontType: Memory

segment.source: FontPath:
segment.target: FontPath:

segment.source: Blocked: true
segment.target: Blocked: true

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Because the FontType is Memory, there’s no associated FontPath.
segment.target: Because the FontType is Memory, there’s no associated FontPath.

segment.source: Event Example 2 - Winlogon
segment.target: Event Example 2 - Winlogon

segment.source: Winlogon.exe attempted loading a font that is restricted by font loading policy.
segment.target: Winlogon.exe attempted loading a font that is restricted by font loading policy.

segment.source: FontType: File
segment.target: FontType: File

segment.source: FontPath:
segment.target: FontPath:

segment.source: Blocked: true
segment.target: Blocked: true

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Because the FontType is File, there’s also an associated FontPath.
segment.target: Because the FontType is File, there’s also an associated FontPath.

segment.source: Event Example 3 - Internet Explorer running in Audit mode
segment.target: Event Example 3 - Internet Explorer running in Audit mode

segment.source: Iexplore.exe attempted loading a font that is restricted by font loading policy.
segment.target: Iexplore.exe attempted loading a font that is restricted by font loading policy.

segment.source: FontType: Memory
segment.target: FontType: Memory

segment.source: FontPath:
segment.target: FontPath:

segment.source: Blocked: false
segment.target: Blocked: false

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: In Audit mode, the problem is recorded, but the font isn’t blocked.
segment.target: In Audit mode, the problem is recorded, but the font isn’t blocked.

segment.source: Fix apps having problems because of blocked fonts
segment.target: Fix apps having problems because of blocked fonts

segment.source: Your company may still need apps that are having problems because of blocked fonts, so we suggest that you first run this feature in Audit mode to determine which fonts are causing the problems.
segment.target: Your company may still need apps that are having problems because of blocked fonts, so we suggest that you first run this feature in Audit mode to determine which fonts are causing the problems.

segment.source: After you figure out the problematic fonts, you can try to fix your apps in 2 ways: by directly installing the fonts into the %windir%/Fonts directory or by excluding the underlying processes and letting the fonts load.
segment.target: After you figure out the problematic fonts, you can try to fix your apps in 2 ways: by directly installing the fonts into the %windir%/Fonts directory or by excluding the underlying processes and letting the fonts load.

segment.source: As the default solution, we highly recommend that you install the problematic font.
segment.target: As the default solution, we highly recommend that you install the problematic font.

segment.source: Installing fonts is safer than excluding apps because excluded apps can load any font, trusted or untrusted.
segment.target: Installing fonts is safer than excluding apps because excluded apps can load any font, trusted or untrusted.

segment.source: To fix your apps by installing the problematic fonts (recommended)
segment.target: To fix your apps by installing the problematic fonts (recommended)

segment.source: On each computer with the app installed, right-click on the font name and click Install.
segment.target: On each computer with the app installed, right-click on the font name and click Install.

segment.source: The font should automatically install into your directory.
segment.target: The font should automatically install into your directory.

segment.source: If it doesn’t, you’ll need to manually copy the font files into the Fonts directory and run the installation from there.
segment.target: If it doesn’t, you’ll need to manually copy the font files into the Fonts directory and run the installation from there.

segment.source: To fix your apps by excluding processes
segment.target: To fix your apps by excluding processes

segment.source: On each computer with the app installed, open regedit.exe and go to .
segment.target: On each computer with the app installed, open regedit.exe and go to .

segment.source: Like, if you want to exclude Microsoft Word processes, you’d use .
segment.target: Like, if you want to exclude Microsoft Word processes, you’d use .

segment.source: Add any additional processes that need to be excluded here, and then turn the Blocking untrusted fonts feature on, using steps 2 and 3 in Turn on and use the Blocking Untrusted Fonts feature.
segment.target: Add any additional processes that need to be excluded here, and then turn the Blocking untrusted fonts feature on, using steps 2 and 3 in Turn on and use the Blocking Untrusted Fonts feature.
